intro: Schizocaena, commonly known as the "false gentian," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Gentianaceae. These plants are characterized by their showy, blue or violet flowers that often have a distinctive two-lipped structure. Schizocaena species are typically found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. They have opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produce small, capsule-like fruits. The genus includes several species, some of which are used in traditional medicine.
